assign_COM.c

00001 // Function written by B. Lachele Foley, 2007
00002 #include <mylib.h>
00003 #include <molecules.h>
00004 //#include "../inc/mylib.h"
00005 //#include "../inc/molecules.h"
00006 /****************** assign_residue_COM() *********************/
00007 /* Finds the center of mass of the molecule and places it in the
00008  * appropriate location.  Similar functions exist for the other
00009  * structures.
00010  */
00011 void assign_residue_COM(residue *r,atype *ATYPE){
00012 int ta=0;
00013 double tmm=0; 
00014 // calculate the molecular weight 
00015 for(ta=0;ta<r[0].na;ta++){
00016         tmm+=ATYPE[r[0].a[ta].t].m;
00017         }
00018 //printf("the molecular weight is %f\n",tmm);
00019 if(tmm==0){mywhine("molecular weight of molecule %s is zero.\n(Have types/masses been assigned?");}
00020 r[0].m=tmm;
00021 
00022 r[0].COM.i=0;
00023 r[0].COM.j=0;
00024 r[0].COM.k=0; 
00025 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00026 // calculate the center of mass
00027 for(ta=0;ta<r[0].na;ta++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00028         r[0].COM.i+=r[0].a[ta].x.i*ATYPE[r[0].a[ta].t].m;
00029         r[0].COM.j+=r[0].a[ta].x.j*ATYPE[r[0].a[ta].t].m;
00030         r[0].COM.k+=r[0].a[ta].x.k*ATYPE[r[0].a[ta].t].m;
00031         }
00032 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00033 r[0].COM.i/=tmm;
00034 r[0].COM.j/=tmm;
00035 r[0].COM.k/=tmm; 
00036 //printf("center of mass is at: %20.12e %20.12e %20.12e \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00037 return;
00038 }
00039 
00040 /****************** assign_molecule_COM() *********************/
00041 /* Finds the center of mass of the molecule and places it in the
00042  * appropriate location.  Similar functions exist for the other
00043  * structures.
00044  */
00045 void assign_molecule_COM(molecule *m,atype *ATYPE){
00046 int ta=0,tr=0;
00047 double tmm=0; 
00048 // calculate the molecular weight 
00049 for(tr=0;tr<m[0].nr;tr++){
00050 for(ta=0;ta<m[0].r[tr].na;ta++){
00051         tmm+=ATYPE[m[0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00052         }
00053         }
00054 //printf("the molecular weight is %f\n",tmm);
00055 if(tmm==0){mywhine("molecular weight of molecule %s is zero.\n(Have types/masses been assigned?");}
00056 m[0].m=tmm;
00057 
00058 m[0].COM.i=0;
00059 m[0].COM.j=0;
00060 m[0].COM.k=0; 
00061 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00062 // calculate the center of mass
00063 for(tr=0;tr<m[0].nr;tr++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00064 for(ta=0;ta<m[0].r[tr].na;ta++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00065         m[0].COM.i+=m[0].r[tr].a[ta].x.i*ATYPE[m[0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00066         m[0].COM.j+=m[0].r[tr].a[ta].x.j*ATYPE[m[0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00067         m[0].COM.k+=m[0].r[tr].a[ta].x.k*ATYPE[m[0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00068         }
00069         }
00070 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00071 m[0].COM.i/=tmm;
00072 m[0].COM.j/=tmm;
00073 m[0].COM.k/=tmm; 
00074 //printf("center of mass is at: %20.12e %20.12e %20.12e \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00075 return;
00076 }

00078 /****************** assign_assembly_COM() *********************/
00079 /* Finds the center of mass of the molecule and places it in the
00080  * appropriate location.  Similar functions exist for the other
00081  * structures.
00082  */
00083 void assign_assembly_COM(assembly *a,atype *ATYPE){
00084 int ta=0,tr=0,tm=0;
00085 double tmm=0; 
00086 // calculate the molecular weight 
00087 for(tm=0;tm<a[0].nm;tm++){
00088 for(tr=0;tr<a[0].m[tm][0].nr;tr++){
00089 for(ta=0;ta<a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].na;ta++){
00090         tmm+=ATYPE[a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00091         }
00092         }
00093         }
00094 //printf("the molecular weight is %f\n",tmm);
00095 if(tmm==0){mywhine("molecular weight of molecule %s is zero.\n(Have types/masses been assigned?");}
00096 a[0].mass=tmm;
00097 
00098 a[0].COM.i=0;
00099 a[0].COM.j=0;
00100 a[0].COM.k=0; 
00101 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00102 // calculate the center of mass
00103 for(tm=0;tm<a[0].nm;tm++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00104 for(tr=0;tr<a[0].m[tm][0].nr;tr++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00105 for(ta=0;ta<a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].na;ta++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00106         a[0].COM.i+=a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].x.i*ATYPE[a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00107         a[0].COM.j+=a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].x.j*ATYPE[a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00108         a[0].COM.k+=a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].x.k*ATYPE[a[0].m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00109         }
00110         }
00111         }
00112 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00113 a[0].COM.i/=tmm;
00114 a[0].COM.j/=tmm;
00115 a[0].COM.k/=tmm; 
00116 //printf("center of mass is at: %20.12e %20.12e %20.12e \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00117 return;
00118 }

00120 /****************** assign_ensemble_COM() *********************/
00121 /* Finds the center of mass of the molecule and places it in the
00122  * appropriate location.  Similar functions exist for the other
00123  * structures.
00124  * NOTE!!  Assemblies within ensembles are assumed to be redundant.
00125  *      That is, the molecules in the ensemble are also represented
00126  *      within the assemblies (copying the molecule pointers keeps 
00127  *      the data from taking extra space).  So, when calculating the
00128  *      center of mass for the ensemble, this function ONLY considers
00129  *      molecules and not assemblies.
00130  */
00131 void assign_ensemble_COM(ensemble *e,atype *ATYPE){
00132 int ta=0,tr=0,tm=0;
00133 double tmm=0; 
00134 // calculate the molecular weight 
00135 for(tm=0;tm<e[0].nm;tm++){
00136 for(tr=0;tr<e[0].m[tm].nr;tr++){
00137 for(ta=0;ta<e[0].m[tm].r[tr].na;ta++){
00138         tmm+=ATYPE[e[0].m[tm].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00139         }
00140         }
00141         }
00142 //printf("the molecular weight is %f\n",tmm);
00143 if(tmm==0){mywhine("molecular weight of molecule %s is zero.\n(Have types/masses been assigned?");}
00144 e[0].mass=tmm;
00145 
00146 e[0].COM.i=0;
00147 e[0].COM.j=0;
00148 e[0].COM.k=0; 
00149 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00150 // calculate the center of mass
00151 for(tm=0;tm<e[0].nm;tm++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00152 for(tr=0;tr<e[0].m[tm].nr;tr++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00153 for(ta=0;ta<e[0].m[tm].r[tr].na;ta++){ // COM = sum(m_i * r_i) / sum(m_i)
00154         e[0].COM.i+=e[0].m[tm].r[tr].a[ta].x.i*ATYPE[e[0].m[tm].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00155         e[0].COM.j+=e[0].m[tm].r[tr].a[ta].x.j*ATYPE[e[0].m[tm].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00156         e[0].COM.k+=e[0].m[tm].r[tr].a[ta].x.k*ATYPE[e[0].m[tm].r[tr].a[ta].t].m;
00157         }
00158         }
00159         }
00160 //printf("center of mass is at: %f %f %f \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00161 e[0].COM.i/=tmm;
00162 e[0].COM.j/=tmm;
00163 e[0].COM.k/=tmm; 
00164 //printf("center of mass is at: %20.12e %20.12e %20.12e \n",m[0].COM.i,m[0].COM.j,m[0].COM.k);
00165 return;
00166 }
